There is a famous textbook software fundations written in Coq: https://softwarefoundations.cis.upenn.edu/

I think it would be beneficial to rewrite it in lean4.

One of the things I did to learn lean was to go through the first volume of that book and translate it into lean. But it has a very CS style, I'm not sure it's of much benefit to mathematicians. I think that people have worked on public translations into lean 3 in the past.
I suggested it as a good way for people with a background in Computer Science to learn about lean.

I think that people have worked on public translations into lean 3 in the past.

Please give me details.
I don't remember any details, you'll have to search this Zulip I'm afraid. This suggestion comes up once a year or so.
